content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. i am not very good with code. could you please help me create a neural network of 20 neurons?
2. learn different languages
3. explore the world
4. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 18:43:54 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As the user, I used the 'browse_website' command with the URL "https://travel.usnews.com/rankings/worlds-best-vacations/" and asked the question "What are the top 10 travel destinations according to this website?" My computer returned the answer that the top 10 travel destinations are Paris, Bora Bora, Glacier National Park, Rome, Swiss Alps, Maui, London, Maldives, Turks & Caicos, and Tokyo. However, when I used the 'browse_website' command to access the hyperlink for travel.usnews.com again, my computer advised me not to execute the command again with the same arguments. I received a list of hyperlinks from various sources including travel.usnews.com. I then used the 'get_hyperlinks' command to access the hyperlink for travel.usnews.com and found that the text does not provide information on things to do in the top 10 travel destinations mentioned in the article. It covers various topics and includes information on U.S. News & World Report's editorial guidelines, privacy policy, and terms and conditions. The website also includes links to other sections such as News, Best Countries, and Best States. My computer returned a list of hyperlinks from the 'google' command, which included several rankings from travel.usnews.com. I then used the 'browse_website' command with the URL "https://www.planetware.com/world/best-places-to-visit-in-the-world-aw.htm" and asked the question "What are some things to do in the top 10 travel destinations according to us news and world report?" Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide information on the top 10 travel destinations according to US News and World Report. It does provide travel guides and articles on various destinations around the world, along with maps and photos to inspire ideas for travel.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Some things to do in the top 10 travel destinations according to US News and World Report include exploring landmarks, trying local cuisine, visiting museums, hiking, biking, and enjoying outdoor activities such as surfing and zip lining. Specific recommendations include visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris, relaxing on Matira Beach in Bora Bora, touring the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain in Rome, staying in an overwater bungalow in the Maldives, and hiking along the Rim and Bright Angel trails in the Grand Canyon National Park. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.usnews.com)', 'Travel (https://travel.usnews.com/)', 'Home (https://travel.usnews.com/)', 'Vacations (https://travel.usnews.com/rankings/)', 'Travel Guides (https://travel.usnews.com/destinations/)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Failure: command list_files returned too much output.                         Do not execute this command again with the same arguments.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
